title: Lesson 36
paragraph: This lesson addresses articulation and style, emphasizing clear, persuasive, and elegant communication.

words.meaning: fluent and persuasive in speaking or writing
words.example: Her speech was eloquent and inspired the audience.

words.japaneseMeaning: 簡潔な、要領よく表現された
words.example: He gave a succinct summary of the report.
The ornate design of the palace impressed visitors.
The verbose lecture lost the audience’s attention.

words.meaning: excessively ornate or flowery in style
words.example: The author’s florid prose was admired by some but disliked by others.

words.japaneseMeaning: 説得力のある、納得のいく
words.example: She presented a cogent argument in favor of the policy.
His explanation of quantum mechanics was lucid.
The singer’s mellifluous voice captivated the audience.

words.meaning: able to express ideas clearly and effectively
words.japaneseMeaning: 明確に表現する、雄弁な
words.example: She is articulate in both speech and writing.
